It was held in [[Coimbatore]], [[Tamil Nadu]] between 23 June and 27 June, 2010.
== Venue ==
[[Coimbatore]], a city located in the western region of Tamil Nadu state was chosen for the meet. '''CODISIA''' has been selected and announced as the venue of the world classical Tamil conference. Tamil Internet Conference was also organized along the Tamil conference. The chairman of the conference is [[Tamil Nadu]] Chief Minister [[M._Karunanidhi|M.Karunanidhi]].
The conference was organized by [[Government of Tamil Nadu]]. Tamil people from all over world participated in the event.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.ndtv.com/article/india/world-tamil-conference-begins-on-wed-in-coimbatore-33198| title=World Tamil Conference begins on Wed in Coimbatore| publisher=ND TV| date=June 22, 2010| accessdate=June 22, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=http://tamil.dinamalar.com| title=World Tamil Conference-2010| publisher=Dinamalar| date=June 22, 2010|}}</ref>
==Preparation== More than 400 journalists from India and other countries took part in the conference. A {{convert|12000|sqft|m2|abbr=on}}. media centre is to be established at a cost of Rs.71.25 lakh. It will have telephone and fax connections, 75 Internet-connected computers, televisions and closed-circuit cameras. A special place is being designated for parking outdoor broadcast vans of television channels. A marathon is planned from various places to Coimbatore, and a short marathon in other places all over the State. Students are expected to participate in these.
To spread awareness, all new buses and government advertisements are to sport the conference logo.
== Participants == The conference was inaugarated by the president of India, [[Pratibha Patil]]. Finnish Tamil scholar [[Asko Parpola]] was awarded to ''Kalaignar [[M. Karunanidhi]] Classical Tamil award''. Tamil scholar V. Sivathambi from [[Sri Lanka]], UNESCO Director Arumugam Parasuraman, MP and political leader [[Sitaram Yechury]] of Communist Party of India (Marxist), [[D. Raja]] of [[Communist Party of India]], [[Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi]] president [[Thol._Thirumavalavan]] and [[Pattali Makkal Katchi]] founder [[S. Ramadoss]] are participating in the ceremony.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.deccanherald.com/content/75662/coimbatore-decked-up-world-classical.html| title=Coimbatore decked up for world classical Tamil conference| publisher=Deccan Herald| date=June 16, 2010| accessdate=June 22, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=http://beta.thehindu.com/news/national/article482292.ece?homepage=true| title=Pratibha Patil inaugurates World Classical Tamil Conference| publisher=The Hindu| date=June 23, 2010| accessdate=June 23, 2010}}</ref> Dignitaries and Tamil scholars will be gifted with an exquisitely engraved Thanjavur' plate.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/chennai/Exquisite-Thanjavur-plate-for-participants-in-World-Tamil-Conference/articleshow/6034536.cms| title=Exquisite Thanjavur plate for participants in World Tamil Conference| publisher=TimesofIndia| date=June 11, 2010| accessdate=June 22, 2010}}</ref>
== Events == Tamil scholar [[George L. Hart|George Hart]] from the [[United States]], will present a paper on Sangam literature and Indian epigraphist [[Iravatham Mahadevan]] will chair a debate on scripts. Rononjoy Adhikari and Kavitha Gangal from Institute of Mathematical Science, who are currently working on a mathematical model to relate the Indus script with the Dravidian language will be involved in the debate on scripts.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/India/5-day-world-Tamil-conference-begins/articleshow/6080504.cms| title=5-day world Tamil conference begins| publisher=TimesofIndia| date=June 23, 2010| accessdate=June 23, 2010}}</ref>
âIniyavai Naarppathuâ a parade depicting depth of Tamil Literature was appreciated by all and it was witnessed by few lakhs of people. In the conference venue, exhibition containing crucial elements of Tamil literature; culture was highly appreciated and the support was so high that it was extended for few more days.
==Theme Song== {{Main|Semmozhiyaana Thamizh Mozhiyaam}} The theme song, "[[Semmozhiyaana Thamizh Mozhiyaam]]" was penned by [[Tamil Nadu]] [[Chief Minister]] [[M. Karunanidhi]] with music by [[A. R. Rahman|A.R. Rahman]].<ref>{{cite news | url=http://beta.thehindu.com/news/article434205.ece| title=World Classical Tamil Conference Theme Song| publisher=The Hindu| date=May 20, 2010| accessdate=June 22, 2010}}</ref>
==Controversies== This conference didn't get the approval from the International Association for Tamil Research.Not all agreed with the academic and intellectual rigor of the latter event.<ref>http://www.srilankaguardian.org/2010/06/karunanidhi-and-politics-of-tamil.html</ref><ref>http://transcurrents.com/tc/2010/06/world_tamil_classical_conferen.html</ref><ref>http://www.indianexpress.com/news/the-political-uses-of-tamil/638301/0</ref>
The conference and associated activities also faced oppositions and criticisms from various political parties and public. Many felt that the event lacked academic and intellectual rigor.<ref> Iqbal Mohideen. [http://www.srilankaguardian.org/2010/06/karunanidhi-and-politics-of-tamil.html Karunanidhi And The Politics Of Tamil Culture]</ref><ref>[http://transcurrents.com/tc/2010/06/world_tamil_classical_conferen.html World Tamil Classical Conference in Tamil Nadu Will Boost Chief Minister Karunanidhi's Image]</ref><ref>[http://www.indianexpress.com/news/the-political-uses-of-tamil/638301/0 The political uses of Tamil]</ref> Others viewed it as a partisan event. The Sri Lankan participants felt ignored. <ref>[http://expressbuzz.com/tamil%20conference/tamil-conference-lankan-speakers-feel-ignored/184817.html Sri Lankan speakers feel ignored at conference]</ref>
